canonical_explanation.text: Plants are living things that make their own food using sunlight, water, and air. Different parts of plants have different jobs: roots absorb water, stems carry water and support the plant, leaves make food through photosynthesis, and flowers help in reproduction. Plants adapt to their environment - desert plants store water, water plants float.
rules: Roots absorb water and minerals and hold the plant in soil
Stems carry water upward and food downward, and support the plant
Leaves make food using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide (photosynthesis)
Plants release oxygen that all living things need to breathe
Different plants have different adaptations for survival in their habitats

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant absorbs water from the soil?
questions.explanation_correct: The root of the plant absorbs water from the soil. Roots are the part of the plant that are under the ground and their job is to take in water and nutrients from the soil to help the plant grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The leaf, stem, and flower are not the parts of the plant that absorb water from the soil. The root is the part that takes in water and nutrients from the ground to help the plant grow and thrive.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant makes food?
questions.explanation_correct: The leaves of a plant make food for the plant through a process called photosynthesis. Leaves use sunlight, water, and air to make the plant's food, which helps the plant grow and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The roots, stems, and fruits of a plant do not make food for the plant. The leaves are the part of the plant that absorb sunlight and use it, along with water and air, to make the food the plant needs to grow.

questions.question_text: What holds the plant firmly in the soil?
questions.explanation_correct: The root of the plant holds it firmly in the soil. Roots grow down into the ground and act like anchors, keeping the plant steady and upright.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The leaf, flower, and fruit of a plant do not hold it in the soil. The root is the part of the plant that grows underground and attaches the plant to the soil, keeping it firmly in place. The root absorbs water and nutrients from the soil to help the plant grow.

questions.question_text: Why is the stem important for a plant?

options.text: It carries water and supports the plant

questions.explanation_correct: The stem is important because it carries water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant. It also supports the plant, keeping it upright and helping it grow tall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stem does not make food for the plant. That job is done by the leaves, which use sunlight, water, and air to make food through a process called photosynthesis. The stem's main job is to carry water and support the plant, not to make food.

questions.question_text: Which part of the plant helps in making new plants?
questions.explanation_correct: The flower is the part of the plant that helps in making new plants. Flowers contain the reproductive parts of the plant, which can produce seeds that grow into new plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The root, stem, and leaf are not the parts of the plant that help make new plants. These parts have other important jobs like absorbing water, carrying water and nutrients, and making food for the plant. But the flower is the special part that has the reproductive organs to create seeds and new plants.

questions.question_text: What do plants need to make food?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need sunlight, water, and air to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. This is why option B is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not make food using only water or only sunlight. They need all three - sunlight, water, and air - to make their own food. So options A and C are incorrect. Plants also don't use soil to make food, they use it to get nutrients. So option D is also wrong.

questions.question_text: What gas do plants use to make food?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants use carbon dioxide (option C) to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. They take in carbon dioxide from the air and use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not use oxygen (option A), nitrogen (option B), or hydrogen (option D) to make their own food. They use carbon dioxide from the air, along with sunlight, water, and air, to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: What gives leaves their green color?
questions.explanation_correct: The green color of leaves is due to a substance called chlorophyll. Chlorophyll is a special chemical in leaves that helps plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and air. This process is called photosynthesis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The leaves are not green because of sunlight, water, or air. The green color is caused by a special chemical called chlorophyll that is present in the leaves. Chlorophyll helps the plant make its own food through photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: What gas do plants release during photosynthesis?
questions.explanation_correct: During photosynthesis, plants use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food. As a byproduct of this process, plants release oxygen gas. This is why the correct answer is option B, oxygen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because plants do not release carbon dioxide, nitrogen, or hydrogen during photosynthesis. Carbon dioxide is actually one of the main ingredients that plants use to make their food. Oxygen is the gas that is released as a result of photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Why do plants need sunlight?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need sunlight to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. The green parts of the plant, especially the leaves, use sunlight, water, and air to create sugar, which is the food for the plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not need sunlight just to stay warm or look beautiful. The correct answer is that plants need sunlight to make their own food through photosynthesis. This process is very important for the plant to grow and stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Which plant is found in deserts?
questions.explanation_correct: Cactus is the correct answer because cactus plants are found in deserts. Cacti store water in their thick, green stems, which helps them survive in the hot, dry desert environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lotus plants are found in water, not in deserts. Roses and mango trees need more water and can't survive in the dry desert climate like cacti can. Cacti are the plants that are specially adapted to live in the desert with their thick, water-storing stems.

questions.question_text: Why does a cactus have thick stems?
questions.explanation_correct: Cactus plants have thick stems to store water. Cacti live in hot, dry deserts where water is scarce. The thick stems act like water tanks, allowing the plant to store water and survive for a long time without rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cactus does not have thick stems just to look big or grow faster. The main reason is to store water. Cacti live in hot, dry deserts where water is hard to find. The thick stems allow the cactus to store a lot of water, which helps it survive for a long time without rain.

questions.question_text: Which plant lives in water?
questions.explanation_correct: The lotus plant lives in water, so the correct answer is C. Lotus plants grow in ponds, lakes, and other water bodies. They have special leaves that float on the water's surface and roots that grow in the mud at the bottom of the water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cactus, neem, and mango plants do not live in water. They are land plants that grow on dry or slightly moist soil. The lotus plant is the only one in the options that lives in water, so C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Water plants like lotus have leaves that:
questions.explanation_correct: Water plants like lotus have leaves that float on water because they are specially adapted to live in water. The leaves are light and waxy, which helps them stay on top of the water instead of sinking.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The leaves of water plants like lotus do not sink in water or turn brown in water. They also do not fall off in water. Water plants have leaves that are specially designed to float on top of the water, which helps them absorb sunlight and make food through photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Mountain plants often have needle-like leaves to:
questions.explanation_correct: Mountain plants have needle-like leaves to protect themselves from the cold and snow. The sharp, narrow shape of the leaves helps them survive the harsh mountain environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. The needle-like leaves do not help the plant look sharp, make more food, or absorb more water. The main reason is to protect the plant from the cold and snow in the mountains.

questions.question_text: Plants that grow on land are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Plants that grow on land are called terrestrial plants. This means they grow on solid ground, not in water like aquatic plants or floating on the surface of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aquatic plants are plants that grow in water, not on land. Floating plants are plants that float on the surface of water. Underwater plants are plants that grow completely submerged in water. None of these options describe plants that grow on land, which are the terrestrial plants.

questions.question_text: Plants that grow in water are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Plants that grow in water are called aquatic plants. This is because they live and grow in water bodies like lakes, ponds, and rivers. Aquatic plants have special features that help them survive in water, like floating leaves or underwater roots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Terrestrial plants grow on land, desert plants grow in dry, hot places, and mountain plants grow in high-altitude regions. Aquatic plants are the ones that live and grow in water, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What do plants give us to breathe?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants give us oxygen to breathe. During photosynthesis, plants take in carbon dioxide and use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food. As a byproduct, they release oxygen into the air for us to breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Oxygen. Plants do not give us carbon dioxide, nitrogen, or hydrogen to breathe. They produce oxygen through photosynthesis, which we need to survive and breathe.

questions.question_text: Which of these do we NOT get from plants?
questions.explanation_correct: We do not get petrol from plants. Petrol is made from crude oil, which is a fossil fuel that comes from the remains of very old plants and animals. Plants give us many important things like food, wood, and medicine, but not petrol.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While plants give us many important things like food, wood, and medicine, they do not provide petrol. Petrol is made from a different type of fuel called crude oil, which is made from the remains of very old plants and animals. Plants are used to make many useful things, but they cannot be used to make petrol.

questions.question_text: We get fruits and vegetables from:
questions.explanation_correct: We get fruits and vegetables from plants because plants are living things that grow them. Plants use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food, and the fruits and vegetables are the parts of the plant that we can eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fruits and vegetables do not come from animals, water, or rocks. They come from plants, which are living things that can make their own food using sunlight, water, and air. Plants grow different parts like roots, stems, leaves, and flowers, and the fruits and vegetables are the parts that we can eat.

questions.question_text: Seeds are found inside the:
questions.explanation_correct: Seeds are found inside the fruit of a plant. The fruit is where the seeds grow and develop after the flower is pollinated.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Seeds are not found in the root, stem, or leaf of a plant. Those parts have other jobs like absorbing water, carrying nutrients, and making food. Seeds are always found inside the fruit, which is the part of the plant that contains the seeds and helps them grow into new plants.

questions.question_text: The process by which plants make food is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The process by which plants make their own food is called photosynthesis. During photosynthesis, plants use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food, which helps them grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Respiration is the process by which plants and animals use oxygen to get energy from food. Digestion is the process of breaking down food inside the body. Absorption is the process of taking in water and nutrients through the roots. The correct process by which plants make their own food is photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Desert plants have spines instead of leaves to:
questions.explanation_correct: Desert plants have spines instead of leaves to reduce water loss. The spines help the plant to store water and prevent it from evaporating quickly, which is important for plants that live in hot and dry environments like deserts.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Desert plants do not have spines to look pretty, make more food, or grow faster. The spines help the plant to conserve water and survive in the desert, which is the main reason why they have this adaptation.

questions.question_text: If a plant's roots are damaged, what will happen?

options.text: The plant will make more flowers
The plant cannot absorb water and may die

questions.explanation_correct: The roots of a plant are like its mouth - they absorb water and nutrients from the soil. If the roots are damaged, the plant cannot get the water it needs, and it may start to die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is correct because the roots of a plant are responsible for absorbing water from the soil. If the roots are damaged, the plant cannot get the water it needs, and it may start to die. Options A and C are incorrect because the damaged roots would not cause the plant to make more flowers or grow faster. Option D is incorrect because the damaged roots would have a negative impact on the plant.

questions.question_text: Paper is made from:
questions.explanation_correct: Paper is made from trees. Wood from trees is turned into pulp, which is then pressed and dried to make paper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paper comes from plants, specifically trees. The wood is broken down into a soft pulp and then made into sheets of paper.

questions.question_text: A plant kept in a dark room will:

options.text: Not be able to make food properly

questions.explanation_correct: Plants need sunlight to make their own food through photosynthesis. A plant kept in a dark room will not be able to make food properly, so it will not grow well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is correct because plants need sunlight to make their own food. Without sunlight, they cannot produce food and will not grow properly. Option A is wrong because plants will not grow very fast in the dark. Option C is wrong because plants need sunlight to make flowers. Option D is wrong because plants need sunlight to stay green - without sunlight, they will start to lose their green color.

questions.question_text: Water lily is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: The water lily is a water plant that lives in lakes, ponds, and other water bodies. It has leaves that float on the water surface and flowers that bloom above the water. This makes the water lily an example of a water plant.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water lily is not a desert plant because it needs a lot of water to survive. It is also not a mountain plant, as it grows in water bodies like lakes and ponds, not on mountains. The water lily is also not a creeper, as it does not climb or spread along the ground. The correct answer is that the water lily is a water plant that lives in aquatic environments.

questions.question_text: Leaves have tiny holes called _____ for gas exchange.
questions.explanation_correct: Leaves have tiny holes called stomata that allow plants to take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen, which is important for gas exchange.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'stomata'. Stomata are the tiny holes on the surface of leaves that allow plants to exchange gases like carbon dioxide and oxygen. The other options like 'pores', 'openings', and 'gaps' are not the correct scientific term for these tiny holes on leaves.

questions.question_text: Plants help prevent soil erosion because:

options.text: Their roots hold the soil together

questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Their roots hold the soil together. Plant roots act like tiny anchors that grip the soil and prevent it from being washed or blown away. This helps stop soil erosion, which is when the top layer of soil gets carried off by wind or water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because: A) Being beautiful does not help prevent soil erosion. C) Making food is important for the plant, but does not directly help stop soil erosion. D) Releasing oxygen is also important, but does not hold the soil in place. The correct answer is B, because the plant's roots actually grip the soil and keep it from being washed or blown away.

questions.question_text: Rainforest plants often have large leaves to:
questions.explanation_correct: Rainforest plants often have large leaves to catch more sunlight. This helps them make more food through photosynthesis, which is the process where plants use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rainforest plants do not have large leaves to store water, keep warm, or protect from animals. They have large leaves to catch as much sunlight as possible, so they can make more food for the plant to grow and thrive in the rainforest environment.

questions.question_text: Roots absorb water from the soil.
questions.explanation_correct: Roots of plants do absorb water from the soil. The roots have special parts that suck up the water from the ground so the plant can use it to make food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not get their water from the air. They get their water from the soil using their roots. The roots have special structures that can take in water from the ground and bring it up to the rest of the plant.

questions.question_text: Leaves make food for the plant.
questions.explanation_correct: The leaves of plants do make food for the plant. This happens through a process called photosynthesis, where the leaves use sunlight, water and air to make the food that the plant needs to grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people might think that leaves do not make food for the plant, but that is not correct. The leaves are the parts of the plant that take in sunlight, water and air, and use them to create the food that the plant needs. This process of making food is called photosynthesis, and it happens in the leaves.

questions.question_text: Plants can make food without sunlight.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need sunlight to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. Without sunlight, plants cannot make their own food and will not be able to survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants cannot make food without sunlight. They use sunlight, along with water and air, to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. Without sunlight, plants cannot produce their own food and will eventually die.

questions.question_text: Plants release oxygen into the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants release oxygen into the air during photosynthesis. This is because plants use sunlight, water, and air to make their own food, and they release oxygen as a byproduct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some plants may not release oxygen, such as plants that live in water. However, most land plants do release oxygen into the air. This is because plants need sunlight, water, and air to make their own food, and they release oxygen as a waste product during this process.

questions.question_text: Cactus is a desert plant.
questions.explanation_correct: Cactus is a desert plant because it has special adaptations to survive in dry, hot desert environments. Cacti store water in their thick, fleshy stems to use when there is no rain, and they have few leaves to prevent water loss.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some plants cannot survive in the desert because they need a lot of water and cool temperatures. These plants would not be able to live in the hot, dry desert where there is not much water available. Cacti, on the other hand, are specially adapted to live in the desert by storing water in their stems and having few leaves to prevent water loss.

questions.question_text: Lotus grows in deserts.
questions.explanation_correct: Lotus plants do not grow in deserts. Lotus plants need lots of water to grow, so they are found in ponds, lakes, and other water bodies, not in dry desert environments.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Deserts are very dry places with little water. Lotus plants need a lot of water to grow and survive. They are found in ponds, lakes, and other water bodies, not in dry desert areas. So the statement 'Lotus grows in deserts' is false.

questions.question_text: All plants grow on land.
questions.explanation_correct: Not all plants grow on land. Some plants, like water lilies and seaweeds, actually grow in water. They have special adaptations to live in the water instead of on land.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It's not true that all plants grow on land. There are many plants that live in water, like water lilies and seaweeds. These water plants have special features that help them survive in the water, like being able to float on the surface or absorb nutrients from the water around them.

questions.question_text: We get wood from plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we get wood from plants. Wood comes from the stems and trunks of trees, which are a type of plant. Trees are a very important source of wood, which we use to make many things like furniture, houses, and paper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wood does not come from animals. It comes from the stems and trunks of trees, which are a type of plant. Plants like trees have stems and trunks that are made of wood, and this is where we get wood from to use for many different things.

questions.question_text: Chlorophyll gives leaves their green color.
questions.explanation_correct: Chlorophyll is a green pigment in the leaves that helps plants make their own food through photosynthesis. The green color of leaves comes from the chlorophyll inside them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people might think leaves are green because of other reasons, like the stem or the type of leaf. But the real reason leaves are green is because of the chlorophyll inside them. Chlorophyll is a special chemical that gives leaves their green color and helps the plant make its own food.

questions.question_text: The stem carries water from leaves to roots.
questions.explanation_correct: The stem carries water from the roots to the leaves, not from the leaves to the roots. The roots absorb water from the soil and the stem transports this water up to the leaves, where photosynthesis happens.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stem does not carry water from the leaves to the roots. It's the other way around - the stem carries water from the roots up to the leaves. The roots are responsible for absorbing water from the soil, and the stem acts like a pipe to transport this water to the leaves, where the leaves use sunlight, water, and air to make food for the plant.

questions.question_text: The _____ absorbs water and minerals from the soil.
questions.explanation_correct: The root is the part of the plant that goes into the soil. It absorbs water and important nutrients from the soil to help the plant grow and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stems, leaves, and flowers are important parts of the plant, but they do not absorb water and minerals from the soil. That job is done by the roots, which are underground and spread out to take in what the plant needs from the dirt.

questions.question_text: The _____ carries water from roots to leaves.
questions.explanation_correct: The stem is the part of the plant that carries water from the roots to the leaves. The stem acts like a pipeline, transporting the water and nutrients the plant needs to grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The roots do not carry water to the leaves. That is the job of the stem. The stem is the part of the plant that transports water and nutrients from the roots up to the leaves. The correct answer is 'stem'.

questions.question_text: Plants need _____ to make their food.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need sunlight to make their food through a process called photosynthesis. During photosynthesis, plants use sunlight, water, and air to create their own food, which is how they get the energy they need to grow and survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'sunlight'. Plants cannot make their food without sunlight. They use sunlight, along with water and air, to create their own food through a process called photosynthesis. This food gives them the energy they need to grow and thrive.

questions.question_text: The green color in leaves is due to _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The green color in leaves is due to a substance called chlorophyll. Chlorophyll is what gives leaves their green color and it is important for photosynthesis, the process where plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The green color in leaves is not due to water or sunlight, but a special substance called chlorophyll. Chlorophyll is what makes leaves green and helps the plant make its own food through photosynthesis. The correct answer is 'chlorophyll'.

questions.question_text: The process by which plants make food is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. During photosynthesis, plants use sunlight, water, and air to create the food they need to grow and thrive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The process of photosynthesis is the correct answer. Photosynthesis is how plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and air. This is the key process that allows plants to survive and grow. The accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is simply 'photosynthesis'.

questions.question_text: _____ is a plant that grows in deserts.
questions.explanation_correct: Cactus is a plant that grows in deserts. Cacti are adapted to store water in their thick, fleshy stems so they can survive the dry desert conditions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Cactus'. Cacti are plants that have adapted to live in the desert. They have thick, water-storing stems and spines instead of leaves to prevent water loss. Other plants like trees and flowers cannot survive in the hot, dry desert climate like a cactus can.

questions.question_text: _____ is a water plant with floating leaves.
questions.explanation_correct: Lotus is a water plant with floating leaves. This helps the lotus plant stay afloat and get the sunlight it needs to make its own food through photosynthesis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Lotus. Lotus is a water plant that has large, flat leaves that float on the surface of ponds and lakes. This helps the lotus plant get the sunlight it needs to make its own food. Other water plants may have leaves that grow underwater or have a different shape, but the lotus plant specifically has floating leaves.

questions.question_text: Plants that grow in water are called _____ plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants that grow in water are called aquatic plants. This is because 'aquatic' means 'living or growing in water', so aquatic plants are specially adapted to live and grow in water environments like lakes, ponds, and rivers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'aquatic' plants. This means plants that grow in water. Some plants cannot survive on land and need to live in water to get the water and nutrients they need. Other plants, called terrestrial plants, grow on land instead of in water.

questions.question_text: Plants give us _____ gas to breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants give us the gas called oxygen to breathe. This is because plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and air. During this process, they release oxygen into the air that we can breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'oxygen'. Plants do not give us carbon dioxide to breathe. Instead, they release oxygen, which is the gas that we need to breathe. Oxygen is very important for our survival, as it helps our bodies to function properly.

questions.question_text: _____ are found inside fruits and grow into new plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Seeds are found inside fruits. When the seeds are planted, they grow into new plants. This is how plants reproduce and make more of their kind.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'Seeds'. Seeds are the parts of plants that can grow into new plants. They are usually found inside the fruits of plants. Other parts of plants, like roots, stems, and leaves, cannot grow into new plants on their own.

questions.question_text: Plants use _____ gas from air to make food.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants use carbon dioxide gas from the air to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. They use the energy from sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to make the food they need to grow and live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'carbon dioxide'. Plants need carbon dioxide from the air to make their own food through photosynthesis. They do not use other gases like oxygen or nitrogen from the air for this purpose.

questions.question_text: The _____ helps plants make seeds.
questions.explanation_correct: The flower is the part of the plant that helps make seeds. Flowers have special parts that help in reproduction, which is how plants make new plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stem does not help plants make seeds. The stem carries water and nutrients up the plant. The flower is the part that helps make seeds, which are used to grow new plants. The correct answer is 'flower'.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps of how plants make food in order.
ordering_items: Water travels up through the stem
correct_answer: Water travels up through the stem
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Roots absorb water from soil, Water travels up through the stem, Leaves make food using sunlight, Plants release oxygen. This is the correct order because plants need water from the roots to make food in the leaves, and the stem carries the water up to the leaves. The leaves then use sunlight, water, and air to make food for the plant, and oxygen is released as a byproduct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is: Leaves make food using sunlight, Roots absorb water from soil, Plants release oxygen, Water travels up through the stem. This is incorrect because the leaves cannot make food without the water that is absorbed by the roots and transported up the stem. The correct order starts with the roots absorbing water, then the water traveling up the stem, then the leaves using that water along with sunlight to make food, and finally the plant releasing oxygen as a result of that process.

questions.question_text: Arrange plant parts from underground to above ground.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from underground to above ground is: root, stem, leaf, flower. This is because the root is the part that is under the ground and absorbs water and nutrients for the plant. The stem carries the water and nutrients up to the leaves, which are the green parts that make food for the plant through photosynthesis. The flower is the part above ground that helps the plant reproduce and make seeds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: flower, leaf, stem, root. This is not correct because the flower is the part above ground that helps the plant reproduce, while the root is the part that is underground and absorbs water and nutrients for the plant. The stem carries the water and nutrients up to the leaves, which are the green parts that make food for the plant through photosynthesis. The correct order from underground to above ground is: root, stem, leaf, flower.

questions.question_text: Arrange the life cycle of a plant in order.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of the plant life cycle is: Seed is planted, Seed sprouts, Plant grows flowers, Fruits with seeds form. This is because the plant starts from a seed, which then grows into a plant that produces flowers. The flowers then turn into fruits that contain new seeds, continuing the cycle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Plant grows flowers, Seed is planted, Seed sprouts, Fruits with seeds form. This is not correct because the plant needs to start from a seed, which then sprouts and grows into a plant that can produce flowers. The flowers then turn into fruits with new seeds, completing the life cycle.

questions.question_text: Arrange plants from driest to wettest habitat.
questions.explanation_correct: The cactus is a desert plant that needs the least amount of water to survive. The mango tree grows in areas with some rain. The lotus is a water plant that needs to be fully submerged in water to live. So the correct order from driest to wettest habitat is cactus, mango tree, and lotus.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be lotus, mango tree, cactus. This is wrong because the lotus is a water plant that needs to be fully in water, while the mango tree can grow in areas with some rain. The cactus is a desert plant that needs the least amount of water to survive, so it should be placed first in the order from driest to wettest habitat.

questions.question_text: Arrange products from plants in order of their main use: food, medicine, building.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Rice (food), Neem (medicine), and Teak wood (building) because rice is a plant product that is used as food, neem is used for medicine, and teak wood is used for building and making furniture.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Teak wood (building), Neem (medicine), and Rice (food). This is not correct because rice is the main food product from plants, neem is used for medicine, and teak wood is used for building and making furniture, not for food.
